lasair_client (class) ∞

class lasair_client(token, cache=None, endpoint='https://lasair-iris.roe.ac.uk/api')[source] ∞

Bases: object

Methods

annotate(topic, objectId, classification[, …])

Send an annotation to Lasair args: topic : the topic for which this user is authenticated objectId : the object that this annotation should be attached to classification: short string for the classification version : the version of the annotation engine explanation : natural language explanation classdict : dictionary with further information url : url with further information about this classification

cone(ra, dec[, radius, requestType])

Run a cone search on the Lasair database. Args: ra (float): Right Ascension in decimal degrees dec (float): Declination in decimal degrees radius (float): cone radius in arcseconds (default is 5) requestType: Can be ‘all’ to return all objects in the cone Can be ‘nearest’, only the nearest object within the cone Can be ‘count’, the number of objects within the cone.

fetch(method, input)

fetch_from_server(method, input)

hash_it(input)

lightcurves(objectIds)

Get simple lightcurves in machine-readable form args: objectIds: list of objectIds, maximum 10 return: list of dictionaries, one for each objectId. Each of these is a list of dictionaries, each having attributes candid, fid, magpsf, sigmapsf, isdiffpos, mjd.

objects(objectIds)

Get object pages in machine-readable form args: objectIds: list of objectIds, maximum 10 return: list of dictionaries, each being all the information presented on the Lasair object page.

query(selected, tables, conditions[, limit, …])

Run a database query on the Lasair server. args: selected (string): The attributes to be returned by the query tables (string): Comma-separated list of tables to be joined conditions (string): the “WHERE” criteria to restrict what is returned limit: (int) (default 1000) the maximum number of records to return offset: (int) (default 0) offset of record number return: a list of dictionaries, each representing a row.

sherlock_objects(objectIds[, lite])

Query the Sherlock database for context information about objects

sherlock_position(ra, dec[, lite])

Query the Sherlock database for context information about a position

streams(topic[, limit])

Get records from a given stream args: topic (string): Name of stream to be returned. return: list of dictionaries, each representing a row.

streams_topics([regex, limit])

Get a list of available streams that match a given expression. args: regex (string, default .*): Search for stream names that match a pattern limit: (int, default 1000): Maximum number of stream names to return. return: List of stream names.
annotate(topic, objectId, classification, version='0.1', explanation='', classdict={}, url='')[source] ∞

Send an annotation to Lasair args:

topic : the topic for which this user is authenticated objectId : the object that this annotation should be attached to classification: short string for the classification version : the version of the annotation engine explanation : natural language explanation classdict : dictionary with further information url : url with further information about this classification

cone(ra, dec, radius=5, requestType='all')[source] ∞

Run a cone search on the Lasair database. Args:

ra (float): Right Ascension in decimal degrees dec (float): Declination in decimal degrees radius (float): cone radius in arcseconds (default is 5) requestType: Can be ‘all’ to return all objects in the cone

Can be ‘nearest’, only the nearest object within the cone Can be ‘count’, the number of objects within the cone

Returns a dictionary with:

objectId: The ID of the nearest object separation: the separation in arcseconds

lightcurves(objectIds)[source] ∞

Get simple lightcurves in machine-readable form args:

objectIds: list of objectIds, maximum 10

return:

list of dictionaries, one for each objectId. Each of these is a list of dictionaries, each having attributes candid, fid, magpsf, sigmapsf, isdiffpos, mjd

objects(objectIds)[source] ∞

Get object pages in machine-readable form args:

objectIds: list of objectIds, maximum 10

return:

list of dictionaries, each being all the information presented on the Lasair object page.

query(selected, tables, conditions, limit=1000, offset=0)[source] ∞

Run a database query on the Lasair server. args:

selected (string): The attributes to be returned by the query tables (string): Comma-separated list of tables to be joined conditions (string): the “WHERE” criteria to restrict what is returned limit: (int) (default 1000) the maximum number of records to return offset: (int) (default 0) offset of record number

return:

a list of dictionaries, each representing a row

sherlock_objects(objectIds, lite=True)[source] ∞
Query the Sherlock database for context information about objects

in the database.

args:

objectsIds: list of objectIds, maximum 10 lite (boolean): If true, get extended information including a

list of possible crossmatches.

return:

list of dictionaries, one for each objectId.

sherlock_position(ra, dec, lite=True)[source] ∞
Query the Sherlock database for context information about a position

in the sky.

args:

ra (float): Right Ascension in decimal degrees dec (float): Declination in decimal degrees lite (boolean): If true, get extended information including a

list of possible crossmatches.

return:

dictionary of contect information

streams(topic, limit=1000)[source] ∞

Get records from a given stream args:

topic (string): Name of stream to be returned.

return:

list of dictionaries, each representing a row

streams_topics(regex='.*', limit=1000)[source] ∞

Get a list of available streams that match a given expression. args:

regex (string, default .*): Search for stream names that match a pattern limit: (int, default 1000): Maximum number of stream names to return.

return:

List of stream names
